explanation: The bug was that the code printed the pop method object instead of calling it: print(num_set.pop, flush=True) just prints a function object rather than removing and printing an integer. I fixed it by calling the method: print(num_set.pop(), flush=True). This is a single-line, single-character fix (adding parentheses) similar in spirit to the small one-line fixes shown in the example diffs.
fixed_code:
N = int(input())
num_set = set(range(1, 2*N+2))
while True:
    print(num_set.pop(), flush=True)
    
    a = int(input()) #aは青木君が宣言した数
    if a==0:
        break
    num_set.discard(a)
